com.ibm.wcs.annotationservice.util.file

Class FileOperations

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.ibm.wcs.annotationservice.util.file.FileOperations
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    LocalFileOperations

    public abstract class FileOperations
extends Object
    Handles file operations for Local File System, HDFS, and GPFS.

      • constructValidURIImpl

        protected abstract String constructValidURIImpl(String directoryURI,
                                                String name)
                                         throws Exception
        Returns the full path of a URI String that contains no invalid URI characters.
        This function creates a full path URI from the directory URI and filename, then converts it to a String object to eliminate invalid characters. Call this method instead of manually making a full path string argument to a FileOperations method.
        Fixes defect : Module names that contain illegal URI characters are not handled correctly.
        Parameters:
        directoryURI - the directory containing the file to operate on
        name - the filename we are operating on
        Returns:
        a valid URI String containing the full path of the filename we are operating on
        Throws:
        Exception

      • copyFileToLocalImpl

        protected abstract void copyFileToLocalImpl(String src,
                                            String localDest)
                                     throws Exception
        Copies a file from the source fileSystem to the local fileSystem.
        Parameters:

        localDest - Destination path on the local fileSystem.

      • getDirChecksumImpl

        protected abstract String getDirChecksumImpl(String dirPath)
                                      throws Exception
        Computes the checksum of the directory. A sorted recursive list of files will be generated for the given directory, and the md5 hash of that list will be returned by this function.
        Parameters:
        dirPath - Path of the directory for which the checksum needs to be computed.
        Returns:
        Checksum of the directory which is computed as described above.
        Throws:
        Exception

      • constructValidURI

        public static String constructValidURI(String directoryURI,
                                       String name)
                                throws Exception
        Returns the full path of a URI String that contains no invalid URI characters.
        This function creates a full path URI from the directory URI and filename, then converts it to a String object to eliminate invalid characters. Call this method instead of manually making a full path string argument to a FileOperations method.
        Parameters:
        directoryURI - the directory containing the file to operate on
        name - the filename we are operating on
        Returns:
        a valid URI String containing the full path of the filename we are operating on
        Throws:
        Exception

      • normalizeURI

        public static String normalizeURI(String origPath)
        Returns a normalized URI string. The following normalizations are performed:
        1) For URIs pointing to a directory, a trailing '/' character is appended if it already does not contains one.
        Parameters:
        origPath - a raw URI passed into the params object
        Returns:
        normalized URI

      • resolvePathToLocal

        public static String resolvePathToLocal(String origPath)
                                 throws com.ibm.avatar.api.exceptions.URIToFileException
        Takes in a URI string that may or may not have a scheme.
        Resolves all scheme-less URI strings to local filesystem.
        Use instead of resolvePath() in compile time.
        Parameters:
        origPath - path to filename
        Returns:
        a URI string with a file:/ scheme
        Throws:
        Exception
        com.ibm.avatar.api.exceptions.URIToFileException

      • resolvePath

        public static String resolvePath(String path)
                          throws com.ibm.avatar.api.exceptions.URIToFileException
        Takes a path string, and if it has no scheme, auto-discovers what scheme (HDFS, GPFS, File) to use.
        If it has a scheme, return it (and fix any illegal characters in the process).
        Parameters:
        path - - String of a URI that can be a path (e.g., /path/to/file.tam), or a full URI
        Returns:
        a legal well-formed URI String that can be used in the URI constructor without throwing an exception
        Throws:
        com.ibm.avatar.api.exceptions.URIToFileException

      • getFileSystemType

        public static FileOperations.FileSystemType getFileSystemType(String uriString)
                                                       throws com.ibm.avatar.api.exceptions.TextAnalyticsException
        Parses the URI String and returns the corresponding filesystem type. If the URI has no scheme, auto-discover the correct filesystem type. Current filesystem types supported : local, HDFS, GPFS
        Parameters:
        uriString - a URI String
        Returns:
        a String containing the type of filesystem this URI string refers to
        Throws:
        com.ibm.avatar.api.exceptions.TextAnalyticsException

      • encodeToValidURIFormat

        protected static String encodeToValidURIFormat(String uriStr)
                                        throws com.ibm.avatar.api.exceptions.TextAnalyticsException
        Encodes URI Strings to a valid URI format to avoid throwing URISyntaxException when illegal characters such as space are part of the URI String. This happens most often with the Jaql interface.
        Parameters:
        uriStr -
        Returns:
        a valid URI String
        Throws:
        com.ibm.avatar.api.exceptions.TextAnalyticsException

      • createURI

        public static URI createURI(String uriStr)
                     throws com.ibm.avatar.api.exceptions.TextAnalyticsException
        Creates a URI from a URI String, which may not have a scheme or legal syntax.
        Parameters:
        uriStr - URI String to turn into a URI object
        Throws:
        com.ibm.avatar.api.exceptions.TextAnalyticsException

      • getInstance

        public static FileOperations getInstance(FileOperations.FileSystemType fileSystemType)
                                  throws com.ibm.avatar.api.exceptions.TextAnalyticsException
        Returns the appropriate singleton instance of FileOperations based on the filesystem type. Lazily creates the instance if it has not been instantiated yet. Currently supports local, HDFS, and GPFS.
        Parameters:
        fileSystemType - type of FileOperations singleton to return
        Returns:
        the appropriate FileOperations singleton
        Throws:
        Exception
        com.ibm.avatar.api.exceptions.TextAnalyticsException
